definition: unpleasant to the eye/objectionable
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Maybe they don't see eye to eye.
sentences.chinese: 也許它們彼此看不順眼。

sentences.english: My father frowns on all but the most conventional of dress.
sentences.chinese: 除最普通的服裝外，我父親都看不順眼。

sentences.english: Feng Mian Street on the day attracted foreign goods could not comment.
sentences.chinese: 馮老爺子對天街招來洋品牌看不順眼。

sentences.english: Whose eye is never pleased has more than tired eyes.
sentences.chinese: 對什麼都看不順眼的人，疲勞的一定不僅僅是眼睛。

definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to be self-interested
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
coward/useless scoundrel
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
in order of arrival/first come, first served
to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
male chauvinism
(coll.) something fishy/shenanigans
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
